meanings.definition: A person's first or given name.
meanings.sent1: Many people have unique forenames that reflect their cultural background.
meanings.sent2: Please write your forenames on the top line of the form.
meanings.sent3: The forenames on his birth certificate were misspelled, causing confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her forenames shone brightly in the sea of common names.
meanings.sent5: The teacher asked the students to share the stories behind their forenames.

meanings.definition: The name that comes before a person's surname.
meanings.sent1: She always signs her full name with both forenames included.
meanings.sent2: The forenames 'John Smith' are quite common in English-speaking countries.
meanings.sent3: His forenames sounded like a royal title when said together.
meanings.sent4: The forenames echoed through the halls, announcing his arrival.
meanings.sent5: The forenames on the plaque commemorated the founding members of the club.
